meanings.definition: The quality of being honorable or worthy of respect.
meanings.sent1: Her honourability shone through when she helped the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent2: His honourability in always telling the truth made him a trusted friend.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's honourability in sharing its nuts with the birds was quite admirable.
meanings.sent4: The old tree's honourability in standing tall through storms inspired the younger saplings.
meanings.sent5: The knight's honourability was as bright as his shining armor.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of having a good reputation or being esteemed by others.
meanings.sent1: The mayor's honourability in the community was well-deserved.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to maintain her honourability among her peers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's honourability in catching mice made it the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The sun's honourability in bringing light to the world is unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's honourability was evident in the respect shown by students.
